member.name: T:MSTS.STFReader
member.summary: Used for reading data from Structured Text Format (MSTS1 style) files.

remarks.para: An STF file is whitespace delimitered file, taking the format - {item}{whitespace}[repeated].
At it's most simple an STF file has the format - {token_item}{whitespace}{data_item}{whitespace}(repeated)
Even, more simplisitically every {data_item} can be a {constant_item}

STF also has a block methodology where a {data_item} following a {token_item} can start with '(' followed by any number of {data_item}s and closed with a ')'. The contents of the block are defined in the specific file schema, and not in the STF definition. The STF defintion allows that inside a pair of parentheses may be a single {constant_item}, multiple whitespace delimitered {constant_item}s, or a nested {token_item}{data_item} pair (which could contain a further nested block recursively).
Numeric {constan_item}s can include a 'unit' suffix, which is handled in the ReadDouble() function.
Within ReadDouble these units are then converted to the standards used throughout OR - meters, newtons, kilograms.
Whitespaces can be included within any {item} using a double quotation notation. Quoted values also support a trailing addition operator to indicate an append operation of multiple quoted strings.
Although append operations are technically allowed for {token_item}'s this practice is *strongly* discouraged for readability.

code.title: STF Example
code.para: error1 "You cannot use append suffix to non quoted " + items

remarks.para: The STF format also supports 3 special {token_item}s - include, comment & skip.

listItem.para: include - must be at the root level (that is to say it cannot be included within a block). After an include directive the {constant_item} is a filename relative to the current processing STF file. The include token has the effect of in-lining the defined file into the current document.
comment & skip - must be followed by a {data_item} which will not be processed in OR

exception.para: STF reports errors using the exception static members
There are three broad categories of error

listItem.para: Failure - Something which prevents loading from continuing, this throws an unhandled exception and drops out of Open Rails.
Error - The data read does not have logical meaning - STFReader does not generate these errors, this is only appropriate STFReader consumers who understand the context of the data being processed
Warning - When an error which can be programatically recovered from should be reported back to the user

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Open a file, reader the header line, and prepare for STF parsing
member.param: Filename of the STF file to be opened and parsed.

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Use an open stream for STF parsing, this constructor assumes that the SIMIS signature has already been gathered (or there isn't one)
member.param: Is only used for error reporting.
One of the Encoding formats, defined as static members in Encoding which return an Encoding type. Eg. Encoding.ASCII or Encoding.Unicode

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.Dispose
member.summary: Implements the IDisposable interface so this class can be implemented with the 'using(STFReader r = new STFReader(...)) {...}' C# statement.

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the resources used by the STFReader.

param.name: disposing
param.para: true - release managed and unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.ReadItem
member.summary: This is the main function in STFReader, it returns the next whitespace delimited {item} from the STF file.
member.returns: The next {item} from the STF file, any surrounding quotations will be not be returned.

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.RewindItem
member.summary: Calling this function causes ReadItem() to repeat the last {item} that was read from the STF file

remarks.para: The current implementation of RewindItem() only allows for "rewind".
This means that there each call to RewindItem() must have an intervening call to ReadItem().

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.MustMatch(System.String)
member.summary: Reports a critical error if the next {item} does not match the target.
member.param: The next {item} contents we are expecting in the STF file.
member.returns: The {item} read from the STF file

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.ReadTokenNoComment
member.summary: Read the next {token_item} skipping past any 'comment', 'skip', '#*' or '_*' tokens.

remarks.para: This cursor should be called when placed at a {token_item} and not at a {data_item}.

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.EndOfBlock
member.summary: Returns true if the next character is the end of block, or end of file. Consuming the closing ")" all other values are not consumed.

remarks.para: An STF block should be enclosed in parenthesis, ie ( {data_item} {data_item} )

returns.para: true - An EOF, or closing parenthesis was found and consumed.
false - Another type of {item} was found but not consumed.

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.SkipBlock
member.summary: Read a block open (, and then consume the rest of the block without processing. If we find an immediate close ), then produce a warning, and return without consuming the parenthesis.

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.SkipRestOfBlock
member.summary: Skip to the end of this block, ignoring any nested blocks

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.IncludeReader
member.summary: IncludeReader is used recursively in ReadItem() to handle the 'include' token, file include mechanism

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.previousItem
member.summary: Remembers the last returned ReadItem(). If the next {item] is a '(', this is the block name used in the tree.

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.tree
member.summary: A list describing the hierachy of nested block tokens

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.tree_cache
member.summary: The tree cache is used to minimize the calls to StringBuilder when Tree is called repetively for the same hierachy.

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.rewindNextReadItemFlag
member.summary: This flag is set in RewindItem(), and causes ReadItem(), to use the rewind* variables to do an item repeat

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.rewindTree
member.summary:
The rewind* variables store the previous state, so RewindItem() can jump back on {item}. rewindTree « tree
This item, is optimized, so when value is null it means rewindTree was the same as Tree, so we don't create unneccessary memory duplicates of lists.

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.rewindCurrItem
member.summary: The rewind* variables store the previous state, so RewindItem() can jump back on {item}. rewindCurrItem « previousItem

member.name: F:MSTS.STFReader.rewindItem
member.summary: The rewind* variables store the previous state, so RewindItem() can jump back on {item}. rewindItem « ReadItem() return

member.name: M:MSTS.STFReader.UpdateTreeAndRewindBuffer(System.String)
member.summary:
Internal Implementation
This function is called by ReadItem() for every item read from the STF file (and Included files).
If a block instuction is found, then tree list is updated.
As this function is called once per ReadItem() is stores the previous value in rewind* variables (there is additional optimization that we only copy rewindTree if the tree has changed.
Now when the rewind flag is set, we use the rewind* copies, to move back exactly one item.

member.name: P:MSTS.STFReader.EOF
member.summary: Property that returns true when the EOF has been reached

member.name: P:MSTS.STFReader.FileName
member.summary: Filename property for the file being parsed - for reporting purposes

member.name: P:MSTS.STFReader.LineNumber
member.summary: Line Number property for the file being parsed - for reporting purposes

member.name: P:MSTS.STFReader.SIMISsignature
member.summary: SIMIS header read from the first line of the file being parsed

member.name: P:MSTS.STFReader.Tree
member.summary:
Property returning the last {item} read using ReadItem() prefixed with string describing the nested block hierachy.
The string returned is formatted 'rootnode(nestednode(childnode(previous_item'.
member.remarks: Tree is expensive method of reading STF files (especially for the GC) and should be avoided if possible.
